title: Abandonforum
content:
It seems to be some kind of tradition that everything that's Keen-related suddenly gets forgotten, abandoned, given up, etc. It has happened with Cerebral Cortex 314, Isis II, the Public Commander Keen Forum (anyone heard of it?) and many mods and/or fangames. I sometimes wonder if it's just Id Software that controls our minds using Mortimer's mind-belts in order to prevent us from resurrecting Keen, but anyway, making Keen stuff seems to be non-sense nowadays. What's the point anyway?------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
Anything you (or anyone else) will ever do will have no point, how's that? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] It's no different with Keen. It's just... take it or leave it, I guess. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

But yeah, iD has definitely something to do with it, for years they've fiddled with my mind and tried to stop my modding. They've been close. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

But still, there has been excellent stuff, and some of it has been under work for a long long time until released. But also, you have to see that people for different reasons, for example because of their changing interests or lack of time, priorities, abandon their Keen work -- we can't (or at least shouldn't) expect them to do the same thing forever. Even I'll be gone one day. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] (Brain failure.)3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
Well, most open-source developers still develop their software even if they won't receive any economic benefit from doing so, and even if they have more interesting/important things to do.------------------------------

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
I guess i'ts the result of unreleased source code for Keen. Wolf3d is an old game as well, but it's modding gets only more intense over the years, as code was released people all the time come up with new ideas, features.
We need source code, or good open-soursed keen recreation.

Also tools for keen4-6 editing seem to be much weaker than for keen1-3 editing. And keen 1-3 have very little enemy selection, which makes keen1-3 modding less fun.

Well, at least in my case - I'm definetely in the mood for Keen.
But I hate mapping, I love only graphic work. So I can help a project graphically, but probably won't have keen mod of my own.
And Shadow Master - it'll help motivating people like me if you'd post some responce when me for example post new graphics update in modding area. If you like it, not....some feedback. I then you wonder why people leave

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
I never really worked much on my fangame, anyway.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
As far as I have been aware of during my short stay here Keen modding tools and patches have been steadily improving, sometimes on a monthly basis. It's just the awareness that needs working on. A good Keen movie would lead to thousands here, I bet you![img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

content:

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
I kind of like the timelessness of abandonment. Sure I haven't updated CC314 in two-and-a-half years, but it's not because I don't want to, it's just not as relevant anymore. And, hey, two of those years have a pretty good reason for lack of activity.

But like KR says, we all have to move on sometime. Heck, even I will, once I finish my FAQ. Finish finish. Of course, that will definitely take some downtime and some boredom to get done and honestly probably won't even happen this year.--------------------

title: Re: Abandonforum
content:
A great, albeit abandoned, fangame demo. The greatest fangame for DOS ever developed. Too bad it wasn't finished. The demo was already great.
It's avaiable at dosclassics.com, but unfortunately the site is currently broken.
I was wondering if I could upload the zip files I downloaded (I still keep'em) to my site.------------------------------

title: ban our fAndom.
content:
It's a freeware game, so there's no reason you can't mirror it.

Isis II had the potential to become a broadly accepted unofficial sequel to the Keen series. 256-colour graphics, multiple weapons (for better or worse), and an overall Keenish feel. In addition, of all the Keen fangames that have been coded from scratch, Isis II is pretty much the most complete (damn us lazy Keeners).

The only games I'm aware of that can compete with its awesomeness are Real Keen Player 3 and Z-1's Keen engine. However, RKP3's storyline doesn't fit into the Keen universe, and Z-Keen is still just a engine rather than an entirely playable game.

In short, it's a must play, despite its incomplete nature.

title: Re: ban our fAndom.
content:
So where can I find it? (The demo version)
And where can I find screenies from it?

You made me curious about it ._.
